column3: Needs rebase.\n
Done.  Is it ok like this?\n
Untested ACK\n

Dislike the cast, but I don't have a better compromise.

ut ACK
If you want, I can provide the template formulation as alternative and you can choose which seems best.  But I believe that the cast is probably the easiest (and also clearest) solution.\n
@domob1812 no don't waste your time\n
Any news on this, should I do some changes to the patch or is it ok as-is?\n

IMO this is fine as-is.

Related: In https://github.com/laanwj/bitcoin/commit/245606c28b483755ec895bd39a6055db7c6c63f5 I've taken the approach of renaming the write-back variant of GetCoins to ModifyCoins. This makes the intent clear, and avoid the misunderstanding that I had above.
Needs rebase after #4683\n
Done.  Can this be merged now?\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4561_d0867acb0e07ac63f03dcc555387f24322e8799e/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te
I don't like this construction.\n
Same here, if you need a const cast that's an indication that something should not be const, or (in case of caching and such) that you need a 'mutable' field.\n

I understand your point.  In this case, however, I believe that the "const" is justified - one could simply copy the implementation of the non-const FetchCoins and replace "iterator" by "const_iterator".  I used the const_cast to avoid code duplication - but if you prefer, I can also implement it with a private template routine that can then be used for both the const and the non-const variant of
In this case, I guess the best way forward is to simply duplicate the three lines of code from non-const GetCoins (as they are rather trivial).  Is that ok?\n

Hm - I see the point now! A template-based common function would be slightly less evil, although if moving the implementation to the header pulls in extra dependencies, it may be best to keep it like this.\n
Maybe a better question: Do we need a non-const FetchCoins/GetCoins at all?\nIs the output ever modified? That'd be pretty ugly.\n
Yes, all utxo updates are done that way to avoid copying.\n
Ok, right.\n
I'm fine with the const_cast here. It's a typical example of not propagating constness correctly automatically.\n
